title: University lecturers to launch strike tomorrow over several issues
byline: The Federation of University Teachers’ Associations (FUTA) has announced that it will engage in strike action tomorrow (30) due to the government’s continued failure to resolve longstanding issues within the university system.

title: Moody’s affirms India’s Baa3 rating, maintains stable outlook
byline: Moody’s Ratings on Monday affirmed the Government of India’s long-term local and foreign-currency issuer ratings and the local-currency senior unsecured rating at Baa3. The ratings agency also affirmed India’s other short-term local-currency rating at P-3. The outlook remains stable.

title: Ex-Minister Udaya Gammanpila arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Udaya Gammanpila has arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) this morning (29) to lodge a complaint.

title: Google to provide free access to Gemini AI Plus for Sri Lankan students – Dy Minister
byline: Google will provide Sri Lankan students free access to its Gemini advanced features, along with other benefits, under its student offer, Deputy Minister of Digital Economy, Eranga Weeraratne, announced today (29).

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts today (29), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: NDDCB reports higher risk of drug addiction among schoolchildren in Western Province
byline: The National Dangerous Drugs Control Board (NDDCB) has revealed that the highest number of drug-addicted schoolchildren in the country is reportedly from the Western Province.

title: Appeals Court sets hearing for petition seeking to invalidate MP Upali Pannilage’s parliamentary seat
byline: The Court of Appeal has scheduled a hearing for February 27, 2026 to consider a petition requesting an order to invalidate the parliamentary seat of Dr. Upali Pannilage.

title: Jaffna District MP Ramanathan Archchuna arrested
byline: Jaffna District Member of Parliament Dr. Archchuna Ramanathan has been arrested by the Fort Police today (29).

title: Two persons seriously injured in an explosion in Kilinochchi
byline: Two individuals sustained serious injuries following an explosion in Thattuvankotti, Kilinochchi this morning (29).

title: Sri Lanka and Japan agree to expand security and economic ties
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met with the Prime Minister of Japan, Ishiba Shigeru in Tokyo during his official visit to Japan.

title: President Anura Kumara to meet Japanese PM Shigeru Ishiba today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is on an official visit to Japan at the invitation of the Japanese government, is scheduled to meet Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba at the Prime Minister’s Office in Tokyo today (29).

title: Bodies of all three persons found in Mawanella bund collapse
byline: The bodies of all three individuals have been found after a mound of earth collapsed onto workers at a construction site in Manikkawa, Mawanella.

title: Workers trapped as earth bund collapses at construction site in Mawanella
byline: An earth bund has collapsed at a construction site in Manikkawa, Mawanella, trapping at least three workers on site.

title: Appeals Court directs wildlife dept. to submit report on human-elephant conflict proposals
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered the Department of Wildlife Conservation to submit, by November 10, information on the steps taken to implement the proposals prepared by the Centre for Environmental Justice to mitigate the human-elephant conflict.

title: MP Ramanathan Archchuna granted bail
byline: Jaffna District Member of Parliament Ramanathan Archchuna, who was arrested earlier today (29) has been granted bail.

title: Energy Minister holds talks to strengthen energy cooperation with India
byline: Minister of Energy Kumara Jayakody, who is currently on an official visit to India, held discussions with India’s Union Minister of New and Renewable Energy, Shri Pralhad Joshi.

title: Court sets date to hear Champika Ranawaka’s petition over ‘hit -and-run’ case
byline: The Court of Appeal has scheduled the hearing of former Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka’s writ petition seeking to annul charges filed against him over the 2016 hit-and-run incident on November 24.

title: Ousted PM Oli banned from leaving Nepal amid probe over deadly protests
byline: Nepal has imposed travel bans on ousted prime minister KP Sharma Oli and four former senior officials as part of an investigation into deadly unrest earlier this month, the interior minister said Monday.

title: CAA raids over 100 shops for selling rice above control price
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has raided a total of 105 shops over the past two weeks for selling rice above the government-imposed control price.

title: Former Western PC member Amal Silva granted bail
byline: Former Western Provincial Councilor Amal Silva who was arrested by the Walana Anti-Vice Squad, with three luxury vehicles valued at Rs. 60 million registered by using forged documents, has been granted bail.

title: Youth nabbed with over 400 live rounds of ammunition and heroin
byline: A 24-year-old has been arrested for the possession of 458 rounds of live ammunition, a T-56 magazine and 75 grams and 400 milligrams of heroin, in Kottawa by the Police Special Task Force (STF). More..

title: Shooter kills at least four, wounds eight at Michigan church
byline: A man who crashed his vehicle through the front doors of a Michigan church opened fire with an assault rifle and set the church ablaze, killing at least four people and wounding at least eight others before dying in a shootout with police, officials said.

title: Bodies of two persons recovered in Mawanella bund collapse
byline: The bodies of two individuals have been found after a mound of earth collapsed onto workers at a construction site in Manikkawa, Mawanella.

title: Netanyahu to meet Trump as Israel faces isolation over Gaza war
byline: Facing increasing isolation abroad and mounting pressure at home, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will defend his intention to “finish the job” in Gaza when he meets US President Donald Trump on Monday (Sep 29).

title: Harry suggests people trying to sabotage reconciliation with King
byline: The Duke of Sussex has suggested people are trying to sabotage his reconciliation with King Charles, as he described media reports about their recent meeting as “categorically false”.

title: Selena Gomez marries Benny Blanco
byline: Selena Gomez has married music producer and songwriter Benny Blanco, announcing the news in an Instagram post showing the couple kissing and embracing on a lawn.

title: China’s former agriculture minister gets suspended death sentence for bribery
byline: Tang Renjian, China’s former minister of agriculture and rural affairs, was sentenced to death with reprieve for bribery at a court in Jilin province on Sunday (Sep 28), according to state news agency Xinhua.

title: Ranil visits Mahinda at Carlton House in Tangalle
byline: A meeting between former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and former President Mahinda Rajapaksa took place this morning (28) at Carlton House in Tangalle.

title: 77-year-old woman dies in bus accident in Rathgama
byline: A woman has died in an accident reported along the Galle–Colombo main road, at the Rathgama junction.

title: First ‘Health and Wellness Center’ opens in Mapalagama
byline: A health service will be established in Sri Lanka which prioritizes the well-being of the people and ensures accountability, while health professionals are committed to safeguarding public health, the Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated.

title: China’s Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge opens as world’s tallest bridge
byline: The Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge in southwest China’s Guizhou Province will open today (28), officially becoming the tallest bridge in the world.

title: President to meet Sri Lankan community in Japan today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is currently on an official visit to Japan, is scheduled to meet with the Sri Lankan community residing in Japan this afternoon (28) in Tokyo.

title: “Law on corporal punishment not a legal amendment aimed at teachers”: PM Harini
byline: The law on corporal punishment is not a legal amendment aimed at schools or teachers, but a reform made for the protection of children throughout society,” said Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: 80% of heart disease deaths globally are preventable, experts say
byline: It is regrettable that 80% of heart disease-related deaths worldwide are preventable, says Dr. Sampath Withanawasam, President of the Sri Lanka College of Cardiology.

title: Singapore urges UN to curb Security Council vetoes
byline: Singapore has called on the United Nations to rein in the rising use of veto powers by the five permanent members of the Security Council and pressed for reforms to make the organisation more inclusive.

title: Ex-Western PC member Amal Silva arrested by Walana Anti-Vice Squad
byline: Former Western Provincial Council member Amal Silva has been arrested by the Walana Anti-Vice Squad, police stated.

title: Infectious disease spreading among monkeys in Polonnaruwa raises public health concerns
byline: A suspected infectious disease is reportedly spreading among monkey and toque macaque populations in Polonnaruwa and Giritale, prompting concern among wildlife officials and local communities.

title: Over 125,000 tourist arrivals recorded in September
byline: A total of 126,379 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in September, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Security stepped up at Vijay’s Chennai home after deadly Karur stampede
byline: Security has been tightened outside actor-politician Vijay’s residence in Chennai after a stampede at his rally in Karur left 39 people, including 10 children and 16 women, dead on Saturday.

title: COPE summons all institutions under its purview for special discussion
byline: The Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) has summoned all institutions under its jurisdiction for a special meeting.

title: 28,500 individuals subjected to inspection during special operation yesterday
byline: A total of 664 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (27).

title: Jaguar Land Rover rescued with £1.5bn UK government-backed loan after crippling cyber attack
byline: JLR suspended production at its UK factories following the cyber attack on 31 August. The shutdown is expected to last until 1 October, leaving the largest UK carmaker’s suppliers in limbo.

title: ‘Mephedrone’ drug discovered for the first time in Sri Lanka - Senior DIG Southern Province
byline: Sri Lanka has detected the highly dangerous synthetic stimulant drug ‘Mephedrone’ for the first time, the Senior Deputy Inspector General of Police of the Southern Province Kithsiri Jayalath stated.

title: Donald Trump to impose 100% tariffs on films made outside US, threatens levy on furniture
byline: US President Donald Trump said on Monday  he would impose a 100 per cent tariff on all foreign-made movies, an unprecedented move that threatens to upend Hollywood’s global business model.

title: Oil prices drop 1% on expected global supply growth
byline: Oil prices fell by more than 1 per cent on Monday as OPEC+ plans for another increase to oil output in November and the resumption of oil exports by Iraq’s Kurdistan region via Turkey raised the global supply outlook.

title: President Anura Kumara meets Japanese FM Katsunobu Katō in Tokyo
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is currently engaged in an official visit to Japan has met Japanese Finance Minister Katsunobu Katō this afternoon (29) at the Imperial Hotel in Tokyo for bilateral discussions.

title: Karur Stampede: Bomb threat to Vijay’s house after 41 people died; Probe on
byline: Following a stampede at a Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) event in India’s Karur, actor-turned-politician Vijay’s residence in Chennai received a bomb threat.

title: Massive support for hartal in Mannar
byline: Local residents and business owners have claimed today’s hartal in Mannar was a massive success.

title: PM Harini tells new recruits to provide efficient public service
byline: The aim of the government is to establish an independent and efficient public service that properly serves the people, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has stated.

title: ASPI closes at new all-time high today
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed at an all-time high after gaining over 77 points today (29).

title: Defence Ministry to get tough on the use of ‘Hakka Patas’ or ‘Cheena Patas’
byline: The Ministry of Defence has advised the general public to refrain from using illegal explosives and to assist by reporting any incidents of manufacturing, possessing, or selling the already prohibited “Hakka Patas” or “Cheena Patas” used to produce them, to the nearest police station or wildlife authorities.

title: Mobile phones of Backhoe Saman’s wife to be sent for forensic examination
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (29) that an inquiry is being conducted pertaining to the mobile phones belonging to Shadhika Lakshani, the wife of Backhoe Saman, who is currently detained under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: Four arrested over recent Tangalle drug seizure remanded
byline: The four suspects arrested in connection with the recent discovery of a haul of heroin and crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘Ice’) in Seenimodara, Tangalle on September 24, have been remanded, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: President discusses investment opportunities with Japanese business leaders
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake participated in a roundtable discussion with leading Japanese business leaders today (29) at the headquarters of the Japan External Trade Organization (JETRO).

title: 12 injured in bus accident in Randenigala
byline: At least 12 individuals have sustained injuries in an accident reported along the Kandy-Badulla main road in Randenigala this evening (29), police stated.

title: UK plans tougher rules for migrants seeking to stay in country
byline: Britain’s interior minister on Monday proposed tough new rules for migrants seeking to settle in the United Kingdom, as the ruling Labour Party bolstered its fight against the hard right at its annual conference.

title: Prime Minister meets IMF Mission Chief for Sri Lanka
byline: The Mission Chief for Sri Lanka of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Evan Papageorgiou, met with Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at Temple Trees on September 29.

title: Sri Lanka’s investment climate remains challenging: US State Department
byline: While 5 percent GDP growth in 2024 exceeded expectations, Sri Lanka’s investment climate remains challenging, according to the US Statement Department.

title: JK Rowling dismisses Watson as ‘ignorant’ over trans rights row
byline: JK Rowling has sent a stinging response to Emma Watson after the Harry Potter actress recently spoke about their relationship and a public disagreement over the issue of gender identity.
